definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Sand can not be added into the material without being sieved .
sentences.chinese: 沒有過篩子的沙子是不能入料的。

sentences.english: Tip jar with lid on to shift product into sifter.
sentences.chinese: 提示罐子的蓋子上改變產品的篩子。

sentences.english: The screen cannot shut out the sunshine.
And I believe that it's leaking like a sieve.
sentences.chinese: 而且，我相信消息走漏得很快，就像過篩子一樣。

sentences.english: Mash the kiwi fruit through a sieve into a bowl.
sentences.chinese: 用篩子把奇異果壓成泥並把果泥濾進碗裏。

sentences.english: If they had scored early on then we would have had to open up and possibly got beaten by a hatful .
sentences.chinese: 如果切爾西早點再進球，我們恐怕就會被打成篩子了。

sentences.english: “Normally, our memories are like sieves, ” he says.
sentences.chinese: “通常，我們的記憶就像是個篩子，”他說。

sentences.english: Screening separates much of the heavier trash by use of different-sized screens.
sentences.chinese: 許多較重的雜質，經由各種不同的篩子篩除。

sentences.english: screening for early signs of diabetes-related kidney disease.
sentences.chinese: 用篩子選的早期徵兆糖尿病有關的腎臟疾病。

sentences.english: You must go over all the products by yourself, and those unqualified must be redone.
sentences.chinese: 一個過篩子，質量不合格的產品一律返工。

sentences.english: I will hole you like a hive if you dare to touch my wife once.
sentences.chinese: 如果你膽敢碰我妻子一個手指頭，我就把你打成篩子。

sentences.english: Then filter the curd through a sieve.
sentences.chinese: 然後用篩子把豆腐過濾一下。

definition: to mix/to blend/(fig.) to spoil/to mess up things/to run around with (sb)/to get involved with/to mix (with other people)
